description: When you sink your teeth into the crunchy perfection that is a Banh Mi Sandwich, it is not an experience you quickly forget. This savory, flavorful Vietnamese street food is the definition of umami and a joy to eat.
name: Banh Mi Sandwich
recipeIngredient: 1 daikon about 6" long, cut into matchsticks
1/2 cup seasoned rice vinegar or 1/2 of white OR apple cider vinegar mixed with 1 tbsp of sugar
Two lemongrass stalks, tough outer layers removed, cut into thirds.
4 scallions, sliced thin white and light green parts
1/4 tsp hot pepper flakes or Aleppo pepper
2 tbsp freshly squeezed lime or lemon juice
1 block of high protein tofu, cut in half and sliced. See the images above. You can also use extra firm tofu.
1/4 cup vegan mayo ( 1 tbsp per sandwich)
2 tsp sriracha (more or less to taste)
4 Persian cucumbers cut in ribbons or sticks

recipeInstructions.text: Place daikon, carrots, and jalapeno in a large glass jar for which you have a tight lid.
Mix ginger, garlic, boiling water, vinegar salt, and sugar and mix well until dissolved
Pour liquid into the vegetables. Close the lid and let it sit on the kitchen counter for an hour and then place the jar in the refrigerator.
